compilations.name: Healthier Holiday Sides
Ultimate Side Dishes

results.name: Winter Fruit Salad With Honey Lime Dressing

instructions.display_text: Slice the pomegranate in half crosswise. Hold the pomegranate cut side down over a medium bowl and tap the back with a wooden spoon to release the seeds. Rinse and drain.
Add the apples, pears, clementines, kiwis, and pomegranate seeds to a large bowl.
In a small bowl or measuring cup, combine the lime juice and honey and stir until incorporated.
Drizzle the dressing over fruit and gently toss until well coated.
Serve chilled.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: "‘Tis the season for falling leaves and seasonal snacks loaded with apple, pumpkin, and pecans. Pro tip: You’ll want to have a big bag of our apple cinnamon chips handy at all times for snacking. Or give classic pecan pie a twist by deep frying it. Finally, we can assure you that these pumpkin cheesecake bars will get you into a festive, autumn spirit."
compilations.name: Autumn Snacks

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 250˚F (120˚C).
Place apple slices on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and sprinkle with cinnamon and salt.
Bake for 40 minutes, until the apples are slightly browned.
Cool completely before serving.
Enjoy!

½ cup roasted, unsalted almonds, chopped

compilations.description: Summer is here, and that means it's froyo season! For a wholesome baking day with your kids, we recommend these delicious and indulgent Froyo Cookie Sandwiches. For a quick healthy snack, these Froyo Fruit Cups are the way to go. What are you waiting for? It's time to get your froyo on!
compilations.name: When Froyo Is Your Fav

instructions.display_text: Combine Greek yogurt, honey, and water in a small bowl and stir to combine.
Dip the strawberries into the yogurt mixture, ensuring they are fully coated.
Dip the yogurt-covered strawberries in the chopped almonds, and place on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray.
Freeze for 2 hours.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Blueberry Frozen Yogurt Bites

components.raw_text: ¼ cup plus 2 tablespoons peanut butter

instructions.display_text: In a bowl, add the Greek yogurt and honey and stir to combine.
Transfer 3 tablespoons of the mixture into 6 lined muffin tins.
Microwave the peanut butter for 15 seconds. Spoon 1 tablespoon of the softened peanut butter over each yogurt cup.
Sprinkle blueberries over the yogurt cups.
Freeze until solid, about 2 hours.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: 4 Lighter Sweet Snacks
11 Fun Recipes For Your Next Girl's Night In

compilations.description: Have an exam coming up? These delicious late night snacks will give the perfect amount of fuel to cram for whatever's next on your (school) plate. From Baked Energy Bites to Cashew Coconut Bars these super quick treats will definitely impress your study buddies and deliver what you need to power through. So, eat your way through them — and go ace that exam
compilations.name: 5 Snacks To Fuel Your Late Night Study Session
Sweet Treats With Yogurt

instructions.display_text: Place almond flour and dates in a food processor and pulse until sticky.
Add the raisins, almond butter, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and salt, and pulse until a sticky dough forms.  Add 1 tablespoon of water if batter seems too dry.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the rolled oats.
Roll the mixture into tablespoon-sized balls and let sit at room temperature for 2-4 hours.
Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
Enjoy!

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).
In a bowl, use a fork to mash the bananas. Add the sugar, ½ cup (115 g) of butter, and vanilla, and whisk until combined.
Add the flour, salt, and cocoa powder, and whisk until fully incorporated.
Use the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to grease a 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) baking tray.
Use the remaining 1 tablespoon of cocoa powder to dust every side of the baking tray.
Pour batter into prepared baking dish.
Use a spoon to add dollops of peanut butter on top of the batter. Use a butter knife to swirl the peanut butter into the brownie batter.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until center no longer jiggles when pan is shaken.
Allow brownies to cool completely before cutting.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: Ever looked over at the overflowing fruit cornucopia on your dinner table and noticed your worst nightmare? That’s right, your bananas are covered in bruises. In fact, you can barely see the yellow! Lucky for you, these banana-forward desserts are here to save the day. Whether you’re craving some old-fashioned banana pudding or a peanut butter banana brownie for your inner Elvis, we’ve got you covered.
compilations.name: 4 Desserts To Make With Ripe Bananas
Family Game Night Recipes
7 Brownie Recipes for Your Night In
Go Bananas With These Mouth-Watering Recipes

compilations.description: If you love peanut butter as much as we do, you have to try these must-have peanut butter recipes. Ditch the plain old PB&J and opt for a sweet surprise like our Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups – they're like Reese's pieces of heaven, but better. If that's not enough, follow that up with our melty and gooey Chocolate Peanut Butter Lava Cake that oozes pleasure from inside to out. Tell us: what peanut butter treat coats your heart in ooey, gooey delight?
compilations.name: Peanut Butter Treats You Need To Make Now!

compilations.description: Fact: No one can resist a perfect brownie. But brownies are a tricky art: you need the perfect 'goo' factor, a wonderful dose of fudge, and a light, crisp crust. Whether you prefer our gooey fudge brownies or our scrumptious loaded brownies, we think it's time for you to make them ALL. Every brownie is unique in its own way. Don't believe us? Try them yourself!
compilations.name: How To Make The Best Brownies

compilations.description: Bananas are one of our favorite snack foods, and for good reason. It's easy to take this humble fruit to the next level with some of our favorite banana recipes. This dark chocolate peanut butter smoothie combines some delicious flavors and makes for a great on-the-go breakfast. Or go wild for this rich and creamy banana pudding or our banana cream sandwiches.
compilations.name: Everything You Can Make With Bananas
For the Love of Banana
compilations.description: Bananas are the perfect fruit to transform into an exciting dessert. They are full of fiber, potassium, and other nutrients. Bananas can be eaten raw or cooked in many ways. They can be baked as muffins or breads, blended into smoothies, used to make ice cream, or even turned into banana chips! We have put together the best dessert recipes you can make with bananas. From Peanut Butter Banana Brownies to Banana Ice Cream Chocolate Bites , these recipes will leave you wanting more and more. No wonder the minions loved bananas!

components.raw_text: ½ cup, plus 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted
¼ cup, plus 1 tablespoon cocoa powder

results.name: 4 Desserts To Make With Ripe Bananas

¼ cup, plus 1 tablespoon cocoa powder

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).
In a bowl, use a fork to mash the bananas. Add the sugar, ½ cup (115 g) of butter, and vanilla, and whisk until combined.
Add the flour, salt, and cocoa powder, and whisk until fully incorporated.
Use the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to grease a 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) baking tray.
Use the remaining 1 tablespoon of cocoa powder to dust every side of the baking tray.
Pour batter into prepared baking dish.
Use a spoon to add dollops of peanut butter on top of the batter. Use a butter knife to swirl the peanut butter into the brownie batter.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until center no longer jiggles when pan is shaken.
Allow brownies to cool completely before cutting.
Enjoy!

instructions.display_text: Place the bananas, egg yolks, sugar, cornstarch, vanilla and milk into a blender and blitz until smooth.
Transfer mixture to a saucepan and cook over medium heat until thick stir constantly for about 8-10 minutes.
Pour mixture into a heat safe bowl, cover and chill for at least 4 hours
To serve, scoop a few spoonfuls of pudding into a serving glass. Add one layer of vanilla wafers, then whipped cream. Repeat.
Serve or allow to sit in the fridge for up to 4 hours.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: Are you bananas for bananas? Well, you should be! They're delicious, versatile, and they're good for you. We're here to celebrate bananas in all their forms: If you're in the mood for something sweet, try some State Fair-worthy Banana Fritters! If that doesn't quite cut it for you, try out our Strawberry Banana Pancake Skewers. Are you ready to go bananas?
compilations.name: Everything You Can Cook With Bananas
Everything You Can Make With Bananas

instructions.display_text: In a mixing bowl, use a fork to smash the bananas.
Add in pancake mix, cinnamon and milk. Whisk together until combined.
Fry in oil. About 1 tablespoon per fritter.
Cook for about 2-3 minutes until they are golden brown and cooked through the middle.
Sprinkle powdered sugar.

Enjoy!

compilations.name: Everything You Can Make With Bananas

instructions.display_text: Unfold the puff pastry. Spread the chocolate hazelnut spread onto the middle third.
Arrange the sliced bananas on top of the spread in a single layer. Bananas may slightly overlap.
Preheat oven to 400°F (220°C)
Cut out a triangle of the top right corner of the pastry. Repeat on the other side.
Cut diagonal slits along both sides of the pastry. Each will be around 1 inch (2 ½ cm) thick.
Fold over the top piece of dough to partially cover the top row of bananas.
Alternating both sides, fold the strips of pastry over the bananas, mimicking a braid pattern.
Trim the excess dough on the sides, and fold over the bottom flap.
Brush the top of the braided pastry with the beaten egg. Transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet for and bake 15 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.
Allow to rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: ¼ cup unsweetened shredded coconut, toasted

results.name: Greek Yogurt Bark With Mango & Strawberry

compilations.name: No Added Sugar Snacks 4 Ways

compilations.description: Tasty Café: Try this amazing assortment of recipes to create an entire meal out of our Almond Joy-Inspired Oolong Tea recipe.
compilations.name: Energy-Boosting Breakfast Recipes

instructions.display_text: Combine Greek yogurt and mango in a food processor and puree until smooth.
Spread mixture onto a parchment-lined sheet tray into an even ¼ inch (6 mm) layer.
Top with sliced strawberries, shredded coconut, and lime zest.
Freeze uncovered until frozen, about two hours.
Break into pieces and serve immediately. Keep any uneaten bark in freezer.
Enjoy!
